name: dirs

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate dirsCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/src/dirs/lib.rs.html#1-328)
Expand description
The _dirs_ crate is
  * a tiny library with a minimal API (18 public functions)
  * that provides the platform-specific, user-accessible locations
  * for finding and storing configuration, cache and other data
  * on Linux, Redox, Windows (≥ Vista) and macOS.


The library provides the location of these directories by leveraging the mechanisms defined by
  * the [XDG base directory](https://standards.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html) and the [XDG user directory](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/xdg-user-dirs/) specifications on Linux,
  * the [Known Folder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb776911\(v=vs.85\).aspx) system on Windows, and
  * the [Standard Directories](https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/FileManagement/Conceptual/FileSystemProgrammingGuide/FileSystemOverview/FileSystemOverview.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40010672-CH2-SW6) on macOS.


## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/#functions)

[audio_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.audio_dir.html "fn dirs::audio_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s audio directory.

[cache_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.cache_dir.html "fn dirs::cache_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s cache directory.

[config_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.config_dir.html "fn dirs::config_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s config directory.

[config_local_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.config_local_dir.html "fn dirs::config_local_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s local config directory.

[data_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.data_dir.html "fn dirs::data_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s data directory.

[data_local_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.data_local_dir.html "fn dirs::data_local_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s local data directory.

[desktop_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.desktop_dir.html "fn dirs::desktop_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s desktop directory.

[document_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.document_dir.html "fn dirs::document_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s document directory.

[download_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.download_dir.html "fn dirs::download_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s download directory.

[executable_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.executable_dir.html "fn dirs::executable_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s executable directory.

[font_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.font_dir.html "fn dirs::font_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s font directory.

[home_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.home_dir.html "fn dirs::home_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s home directory.

[picture_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.picture_dir.html "fn dirs::picture_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s picture directory.

[preference_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.preference_dir.html "fn dirs::preference_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s preference directory.

[public_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.public_dir.html "fn dirs::public_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s public directory.

[runtime_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.runtime_dir.html "fn dirs::runtime_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s runtime directory.

[state_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.state_dir.html "fn dirs::state_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s state directory.

[template_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.template_dir.html "fn dirs::template_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s template directory.

[video_dir](https://docs.rs/dirs/latest/dirs/fn.video_dir.html "fn dirs::video_dir")
    Returns the path to the user’s video directory.

readme_summary: The `dirs` crate is a lightweight library that provides platform-specific, user-accessible directory paths for storing configuration, cache, and other data on Linux, Redox, Windows (Vista and later), and macOS. It supports 18 functions to retrieve paths for common directories, such as home, desktop, documents, downloads, and runtime, leveraging standards like XDG, Known Folders, and macOS Standard Directories. This simplifies cross-platform directory management for applications.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Platform Support  
✅ **Factual**: The `dirs` crate provides platform-specific directory paths for Linux, Redox, Windows (≥ Vista), and macOS by leveraging native mechanisms like XDG specifications, Known Folder APIs, and Standard Directories.  
❌ **Counterfactual**: The `dirs` crate supports all major platforms, including Android and iOS, by leveraging their respective directory APIs.  

---

### Pair 2: Functionality Scope  
✅ **Factual**: The `dirs` crate includes 18 public functions, such as `home_dir`, `cache_dir`, and `config_dir`, to retrieve paths to commonly used directories like the home, cache, and configuration directories.  
❌ **Counterfactual**: The `dirs` crate includes over 30 public functions, covering advanced use cases like retrieving temporary directories and network shares.  

---

### Pair 3: XDG Compliance  
✅ **Factual**: On Linux, the `dirs` crate adheres to the XDG Base Directory and XDG User Directory specifications to determine paths for configuration, cache, and data storage.  
❌ **Counterfactual**: On Linux, the `dirs` crate bypasses XDG specifications and directly queries the `/etc` directory for configuration paths.
